intro: Jacea smolinensis, commonly known as the Smolin's jacea, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous roots. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a bluish-green hue and produces small, yellowish flowers during the summer months. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to withstand harsh mountainous conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
